Input/Output Functions¶

group io

Functions to load data and setup and initialize structs.

Functions

bool load_lookup_table(table_t &table, std::string filename = "dmin_wetgrowth_lookup.dat", uint32_t ndT = 61)

Based on init_dmin_wg_gr_ltab_equi(‘dmin_wetgrowth_lookup.dat’, unitnr, 61, ltabdminwgg) Loads a lookup table for calculating the growth of rain droplets or something.

Parameters

  • table: Reference to the dataobject where the lookup table is going to be stored.

  • filename: Path to the data file.

  • ndT: Number of equidistant table vectors.

void init_nc_parameters(nc_parameters_t &nc, uint32_t n = 32, uint32_t n_timesteps = 7922)

Initialize the nc parameters to default values. and allocate memory.

Parameters

  • nc: The struct where the parameters are initialized.

  • n: The number of trajectories in the netCDF file.

  • n_timesteps: The maximum number of timesteps in the netCDF file.

void load_nc_parameters_var(nc_parameters_t &nc, netCDF::NcFile &datafile)

Load variables from the netCDF file such that data can be loaded using load_nc_parameters()

Parameters

  • nc: Struct where to load the variables.

  • datafile: The netCDF file.

void load_nc_parameters(nc_parameters_t &nc, std::vector<size_t> &startp, std::vector<size_t> &countp, reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, uint64_t num_sub_steps)

Load the parameters from the netCDF file where load_nc_parameters_var() must have been called beforehand.

Parameters

  • nc: s Struct where to store the values.

  • startp: Must have two values with index from where to load values. Depending on the NetCDF file, startp[0] may refer to the trajectory id.

  • countp: Must have two values for how many values to load. Depending on the NetCDF file, countp[0] may refer to the trajectory id. Usually we set the values to 1.

  • ref_quant: Reference quantities to transform between units.

void init_input_parameters(input_parameters_t &in)

Initialize the input parameters to default values.

Parameters

  • in: Structure where to store the input parameters.

void init_global_args(global_args_t &arg)

Initialize global args for parsing command line arguments.

Parameters

  • arg: Struct that shall be initialized.

void set_input_from_arguments(global_args_t &arg, input_parameters_t &in)

Set the input parameters with the data from the global arguments.

Parameters

  • arg: Stuct with command line arguments.

  • in: Struct where the input parameters will be stored.

int write_reference_quantities(std::string &out_filename, reference_quantities_t &ref_quant)

Write the file with reference values ending with “__reference_values.txt” that can be read in Python with Numpy. The order is: Temperature, pressure, mixing ratio, particle number, ascent velocity, time, height.

Return

Errorcode (0=no errors; 1=simulation breaking error)

Parameters

  • out_filename: String with filename.

  • ref_quant: reference_quantities_t with all the reference values.

int write_headers(std::string &out_filename)

Write the header for simulation results files and for files with derivatives which have “_diff_” in their name.

Return

Errorcode (0=no errors; 1=simulation breaking error)

Parameters

  • out_filename: String with filename.

int read_init_netcdf(std::vector<double> &y_init, nc_parameters_t &nc_params, size_t &lenp, reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, const char *input_file, const uint32_t traj, model_constants_t &cc)

Read initial values from the netcdf file and stores them to y_init. Also stores the amount of trajectories in the input file to lenp and several quantities to cc such as the number of steps to simulate and to nc_params, which is used to read from netcdf files.

Return

Errorcode (0=no errors; 1=simulation breaking error)

Parameters

  • y_init: Array of num_comp many doubles

  • nc_params: Struct used for reading netcdf files

  • lenp: On out: Number of trajectories available

  • ref_quant: Reference quantities used to change from netcdf units to simulation units

  • input_file: Path to input netcdf file as char array

  • traj: ID of input trajectory to read

  • cc: Model constants. On out: Added number of simulation steps

void open_netcdf(int &ncid, std::vector<size_t> &startp, std::vector<size_t> &countp, const char *input_file, const uint32_t traj)

Open NETCDF file for reading and store some information in ncid, startp, countp.

Parameters

  • ncid: On out: contains id of netcdf file (needed for closing it)

  • startp: On out: contains dimensions info for reading countp On out: contains dimensions info for reading input_file Char array of input file

void read_netcdf_write_stream(const char *input_file, std::vector<size_t> &startp, std::vector<size_t> &countp, nc_parameters_t &nc_params, model_constants_t &cc, input_parameters_t &input, reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &y_single_old, std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &inflow, std::vector<int> &ids, int &traj_id, const uint32_t t)

Read from netcdf file. Alter current values used for simlation if given timestep is encountered. Writes values to output stringstream.

void write_output(const model_constants_t &cc, const nc_parameters_t &nc_params, const std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &y_single_new, const std::vector<std::array<double, num_par>> &y_diff, const uint32_t sub, const uint32_t t, const double time_new, const uint32_t traj_id, const uint32_t write_index, const uint32_t snapshot_index, const bool last_step)

Store simulation results and gradients to string stream and dump it if timestep is reached to do so.

int parse_arguments(int argc, char **argv, global_args_t &global_args)

Parse the arguments and store them in global_args.

Return

Error code.

Parameters

  • argc: Number of arguments

  • argv: Pointer to arguments

  • global_args: Structure to store global args.

Variables

const char *optString = "w:f:d:e:i:b:o:l:s:t:a:r:p:n:?"

String used to parse commandline input.
